business.headline: Payment aggregators may face 18% GST for transactions up to Rs 2,000: ReportThe final decision will be made at the GST Council's 54th meeting, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

US adds 1,42,000 jobs in August; unemployment rate drops to 4.2%While the job data fell short of expectations, a slight dip in the unemployment rate to 4.2% indicated that the labour market is gradually cooling off, but not dramatically.

IPO investors are not looking beyond listing gains, are they missing out?According to a Sebi study, 70% of the shares, by value, were sold within a year of the IPO. The quick turnover is particularly noticeable in cases where IPO shares see a strong rise in value right after listing.

Anant Ambani donates 20 kg gold crown worth Rs 15 crore to Lalbaugcha RajaLalbaugcha Raja, Mumbai's most popular Ganesh idol, was unveiled on Thursday ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi. Devotees visit the Lalbaugcha Raja for darshan during the 10-day Ganesh festival.

Explained: Why Godfrey Phillips shares hit record high despite market downturnAt the closing bell, the shares of Godfrey Phillips were up 12.69% at Rs 7,204.35 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, the stock jumped 14.50% to reach a record high of Rs 7,320, defying a sharp correction in the domestic indices.

Tata Motors shares decline for 6th straight day. Is it a good time to buy?Tata Motors stock settled over 1.8% lower on Friday, extending losses for the sixth consecutive session. Read on to know whether it is the right time to buy the stock.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points, Nifty slips under 24,900 on US data jittersThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 1017.23 points to close at 81,183.93, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 292.95 points lower to end at 24,852.15.
Godfrey Phillips set to consider 2:1 bonus issue; shares jump over 9%A bonus issue is a way for companies to reward existing shareholders without making them pay for the additional shares.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points, investors lose Rs 5 lakh croreThe bloodbath on Dalal Street has wiped off nearly Rs 5 lakh crore from the market capitalisation of all listed companies on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Government may slash petrol, diesel prices as global crude oil rates fallUS crude oil prices dropped by more than 1% on Wednesday, falling below $70 per barrel. Brent crude prices followed suit, falling by $1 to reach $72.75 per barrel.
Bina Modi to vote on behalf of family trust at Godfrey Phillips AGMThe Delhi High Court recently allowed Bina to cast her vote on behalf of the trust, which holds a 47.5% stake in the company.

Goldman Sachs gives SBI 'sell' rating with revised target price. Know whyThe brokerage highlighted a growing risk-reward imbalance for SBI's stock, driven by challenges in maintaining a strong return on assets.

India's household food spending dips to less than 50%: ReportThe change in spending, highlighted in a recent report by the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister (EAC-PM), signals a shift in how Indian families allocate their monthly budgets.
Sensex, Nifty down 1%: What's behind today's stock market turbulence?Today's market turbulence is partly linked to investor jitters ahead of the US non-farm payrolls report expected later today.
Explained: Why Vodafone Idea shares tumbled over 14% today As of 11:51 am, Vodafone Idea's shares were trading at Rs13.60, down nearly 10%.
Boss Packaging Solutions makes debut on NSE SME at 25% premiumBoss Packaging Solutions listing: The stock was listed at Rs 82.5 on the NSE SME, marking a 25% premium over its IPO price of Rs 66.
Sensex down nearly 900 points, investors lose over Rs 4 lakh croreStock market turmoil: At 11:27 am, the Sensex was down 883.93 points to 81,317.23, while the Nifty50 fell 255.95 points to 24,889.15.

Rekha Jhunjhunwala-backed Baazar Style Retail lists a flat on Dalal Street Baazar Style Retail listing: Baazar Style Retail's IPO received strong interest from investors, with an overall subscription of nearly 41 times by the time it closed.
Sensex falls nearly 600 points, Nifty tumbles ahead of key US jobs dataThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 553.9 points to 81,647.26 at 9:55 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 156.30 points to 24,988.80.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Vistara diverts Mumbai-Frankfurt flight to Turkey due to security reasonsFlight UK27 from Mumbai to Frankfurt was diverted to Turkey's Erzurum airport due to security reasons, the airline said in a post on X.

AAP-Congress alliance in Haryana hits roadblock over seat-sharing: SourcesAAP sources have indicated that if Congress insists on maintaining the current seat-sharing formula, an alliance will not be formed for the October 5 Assembly elections.

Praveen Kumar wins India's record-breaking sixth gold at Paris Paralympics Praveen Kumar recorded the highest jump of 2.08m to win the men's high jump T64 finals at the Paris Paralympics 2024. Praveen won his second medal in Paralympic high jump competitions, and India's 11th overall.
Payment aggregators may face 18% GST for transactions up to Rs 2,000: ReportThe final decision will be made at the GST Council's 54th meeting, chaired by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.

Upload, undress, blackmail: AI 'nudify' apps emerge as new weapons of extortionImagine you are travelling on the metro. Someone secretly takes your photo and by the time you get down at your stop, he or she could have a hyperrealistic nude photo of you. Welcome to the scary world of "undressing" apps.
12 dead, 16 injured after bus crashes into mini-truck in UP's HathrasA roadways bus hit a mini-truck from behind on National Highway 93 in UP's Hathras, killing 12 people and injuring 16.

Vinesh Phogat joins Congress: Wrestlers' stir politically motivated? Editors debateThe big focus of this episode of Democratic Newsroom is on wrestlers Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia's political plunge.

Article 370 is history, won't be back: Amit Shah ahead of Jammu and Kashmir pollsThe BJP's poll manifesto for Jammu-Kashmir Assembly elections promises a new tourist hub near Rajouri, and several tourist centres in Jammu.

From bans to reels being burnt, the Aandhi some Emergency films weatheredThe Emergency in India in 1975 led to severe film censorship, impacting movies like Aandhi and Kissa Kursi Ka, which had to do with the life and politics of then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. As Kangana Ranaut's Emergency is caught in a controversy, here's a look at films on Emergency that raised a storm, or silently conveyed the message.

Sathyabama welcomes the Yorker Champion Jasprit BumrahIn a memorable event, Sathyabama University had the honour of hosting one of India's most celebrated cricket icons, Mr. Jasprit Bumrah. The university's President, Dr. Marie Johnson, and Chancellor, Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, warmly welcomed the champion fast bowler, renowned for his impeccable yorkers, to the campus.

The atmosphere was electric as students gathered in large numbers, eager to catch a glimpse of the cricket sensation. Their excitement and enthusiasm were palpable, reflecting the immense respect and admiration they hold for Bumrah. His visit not only inspired the students but also created an unforgettable experience, further strengthening the bond between sports and academia at Sathyabama University.

Bengal Governor sends anti-rape bill for President's considerationIn a statement posted on X, the Raj Bhavan, however, expressed its displeasure over the failure of the Assembly secretariat to provide the text of the debates and its translation as required under the rules.

Vinesh Phogat, new Congress entrant, to contest Haryana polls from Julana: SourcesVinesh Phogat, who joined Congress earlier today, will contest Haryana polls from the Julana seat, sources said. Bajrang Punia, however, is not likely to contest polls.

Deepika Padukone-Ranveer Singh seek blessings at Siddhivinayak TempleParents-to-be Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh visited the Siddhivinayak Temple in Mumbai, on Friday, September 6. Several pictures of the couple were shared online.

After Team India stint, Rahul Dravid returns to Rajasthan Royals as head coachIPL 2025: A month after his successful stint as Indian senior national men's team head coach, Rahul Dravid returned to Rajasthan Royals. The former cricketer will take over as the head coach of the 2008 champions in IPL 2025.
US citizen shot dead by Israeli troops during West Bank protest: ReportThe woman was rushed to Rafidia hospital in Nablus with a gunshot to the head and was later pronounced dead.

Are pregnancy cravings real or are they just attention-seeking behaviour?'What are you craving?' is a question people often ask pregnant women. But do these cravings really happen because of pregnancy, or could they be more related to behavioural factors?
India's climate swap: Flood-prone areas now face drought, and vice versaBy 2036, more than 1.47 billion Indians could be highly exposed to climate extremes.

How NSG commandos ended plane-hijack crisis in Amritsar in 5 minutesIn 1993, an Indian Airlines Delhi-Srinagar with 141 people on board was hijacked by a Hizb-ul-Mujahideen terrorist, who hid two pistols in the plaster moulds on his legs. As the plane stopped at Amritsar, NSG commandos stormed IC 427 and ended the hostage crisis in just five minutes. This was in sharp contrast to the IC 814 Kandahar hijacking of 1999.

Woman raped on busy Ujjain road, bystanders film it, post video onlineThe accused coaxed the woman to drink alcohol and when she was intoxicated, he took her to a roadside shelter and raped her. An eyewitness filmed the incident and posted the video online, where it quickly went viral.
When wrestlers were being dragged...: Congress's Vinesh Phogat attacks BJPWrestler Vinesh Phogat joined Congress on Friday and said she was proud of joining a party that "supports women".

Watch: Former NYC Mayor sprinkles coconut over pizza to support Kamala HarrisFormer New York City Mayor, Bill de Blasio, has created a quirky video where he eats a pizza topped with coconut to show his support for Kamala Harris's presidential campaign. The stunt is part of 'Paisans for Kamala', a virtual event featuring Italian-American celebrities and politicians, to back Harris's campaign.

Canada is approving fewer visas, turning away immigrants in record numbersCanada is turning away record numbers of immigrants, with a 20% increase in visa rejections and border refusals. In July, 5,853 foreign travellers were refused entry, and 285 visa-holders were deemed inadmissible. The government is approving fewer visas, citing public concerns over housing shortages and high prices.

Never realised leaders in Delhi hated me: Omar Abdullah alleges poll 'conspiracy'National Conference leader Omar Abdullah said that "leaders in Delhi" hated him and alleged there was a conspiracy against him in the polls. He also questioned why only jailed candidates were contesting against him.

Govt again issues high risk warning for Google Chrome users, here is why you should not ignore itThe Indian Computer Emergency Response Team has issued a high-severity warning for Google Chrome users, urging them to update their browsers immediately.

Avenged Sevenfold to Bhayanak Maut, metal bands to look out for at Bandland 2024Bandland 2024 is returning to Bengaluru in November with Avenged Sevenfold headlining the event, promising a musical treat for all. Have a look at the metal bands performing at the event.

Kapil Sharma postponed America tour so I could shoot for IC 814: Rajiv ThakurNetflix's 'IC 814: The Kandahar Hijack' has been at the centre of controversy, but the series is also receiving praise from critics and audiences alike. Rajiv Thakur, who played the main antagonist, shared his experience and gratitude towards his colleagues and family for their support in an exclusive conversation with IndiaToday.in.

Kamal Haasan jets off to US to study artificial intelligence: ReportVeteran actor Kamal Haasan has reportedly embarked on a journey to the United States to undertake a 90-day course in Artificial Intelligence at a leading institute.

'Stree 2' director reacts to poster comparisons with 'Stranger Things'Filmmaker Amar Kaushik addressed comparisons between the 'Stree 2' poster and 'Stranger Things', clarifying his intentions behind the similarities. The film stars Rajkummar Rao and Shraddha Kapoor in lead roles.

sports.headline: Bergwijn hits back after Netherlands coach criticises move to Saudi ArabiaSteven Bergwijn has openly criticized national team coach Ronald Koeman for his remarks regarding Bergwijn's recent transfer to Saudi Arabian club Al-Ittihad. The move led to Bergwijn's exclusion from the Netherlands squad, sparking a heated exchange between the player and coach.

Lack of game time fuels New Zealand spinners in subcontinent: Ajaz Patel Speaking to reporters ahead of the first Test between New Zealand and Afghanistan in Greater Noida, left-arm spinner Ajaz Patel spoke about the importance of staying hungry when the BlackCaps spinners get opportunities in the subcontinent. Ajaz shed light on how difficult it is to deal with the lack of game time for spinners in home conditions.

Paris Paralympics: Golden boy Praveen Kumar once fought feelings of inferiority Paralympics: Praveen Kumar was once plagued by feelings of inferiority due to a shorter leg. On Friday, the 21-year-old was brimming with confidence when he set a new Asian record and won gold in the men's high jump T-64 category.

Bellingham, Militao, Camavinga out: Real Madrid slapped with injury crisisReal Madrid's injury crisis deepens with nine players sidelined, including key stars Jude Bellingham and Eduardo Camavinga. Manager Carlo Ancelotti faces a tough challenge in fielding a competitive squad as the La Liga season progresses and Champions League beckons.

After Paralympics archery gold, Harvinder sets sights on completing PhDAfter his historic gold in men's recurve archery at the Paris Paralympics, Harvinder Singh now aims to complete his PhD in economics. Harvinder is the first Indian para archer to win a Paralympic medal.

Harvinder, Preeti to be India's flag-bearers for Paralympics closing ceremonyParis Paralympics 2024: Gold medal-winning archer Harvinder Singh and twice-medal winner Preeti Pal will be India's flag bearers during the closing ceremony of the Games on Sunday.

Shreyas Iyer, Devdutt Paddikal's fifties hand India D edge over India C Shreyas Iyer and Devdutt Padikkal's crucial knocks helped India D secure a strong lead against India C in their Duleep Trophy clash, setting up a promising position for Day 3 despite early setbacks.

Musheer, Navdeep lead India B's revival vs India A on Day 2Navdeep Saini made a strong case for his return to the national setup with an impressive new-ball spell, helping India B keep India A in check at 134 for two by the end of Day 2 in their Duleep Trophy encounter in Bengaluru on Friday.

The former cricketer will take over as the head coach of the 2008 champions in IPL 2025.

Afghanistan's Naveed Zadran ruled out of one-off Test against New ZealandAfghanistan seamer Naveed Zadran has been ruled out of the one-off Test against New Zealand due to side strain injury. The two teams will lock horns in a single Test match beginning from September 9.

Love watching R Ashwin bowl: Nathan Lyon ahead of Border-Gavaskar battleNathan Lyon praises R Ashwin's bowling ahead of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, highlighting their respectful rivalry and Ashwin's mastery. Marnus Labuschagne adds anticipation, eager to face India's formidable fast-bowling attack in Australian conditions.

Javelin star Sumit Antil exclusive: 'Want to experience feeling of throwing 80m' Paris Paralympics: Speaking to IndiaToday.in, javelin gold medallist Sumit Antil said he is going to work towards throwing 80m after a well-deserved break with family. Sumit recalled a crucial piece of advice from Olympic hero Neeraj Chopra and a heart-warming chat with the legendary Devendra Jhajharia.

Watch: Musheer Khan's monstrous six lands on Chinnaswamy's roof in Duleep TrophyDuleep Trophy: Musheer Khan hit a monstrous six which landed on the roof of Chinnaswamy Stadium and bounced back onto the field. However, in the same over, he was dismissed by Kuldeep Yadav for 181 runs.

R Ashwin highlights Shan Masood-Babar Azam conundrum in Pakistan CricketIndia off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin highlighted a major issue in Pakistan cricket with Shan Masood captaining he poster boy of Pakistan, Babar Azam.

Never said I wanted to compete in both Olympics and Paralympics: Sumit AntilParalympics 2024: Speaking to IndiaToday.in, javelin star Sumit Antil said he was not happy with his effort in Paris. Despite defending his title with a gold medal, Sumit rued missing another world record. The Haryana athlete, supported by GoSports Foundation, cleared the air around his plans for the future in a candid chat.

R Ashwin hails Tamil Nadu teammate Baba Indrajith's fighting 72 in Duleep TrophyRavichandran Ashwin hailed his Tamil Nadu teammate Baba Indrajith for his gritty knock for India C in the Duleep Trophy tournament. Indrajith scored 72 runs in IndiaC's first innings.

Concussion sub and other new ISL rules ahead of 2024-25 seasonThe Indian Super League (ISL) introduces new rules for the 2024-2025 season, including concussion substitutions and the ability to challenge wrongful red cards, aiming to improve fairness, player safety, and the development of homegrown talent.

England vs Sri Lanka 3rd Test match Live streaming: When and where to watch liveThe 3rd Test match between England and Sri Lanka will be played at The Oval. Find out all the live streaming details of the last match of the English summer.

Watch: Cristiano Ronaldo gets emotional after netting 900th career goalCristiano Ronaldo became emotional after netting his milestone 900th career goal during Portugal's UEFA Nations League win over Croatia. The moment highlighted his incredible journey, solidifying his status as one of football's all-time greats.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
